name: The Old Inn Crawfordsburn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a lot of charm, friendly staff and the rooms looked like the set of an old horror movie.. Creaking floorboards, four poster beds and old pictures on the wall helped this feeling.
reviews.title: Hotel experience with a diference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However this all added to the charm. The "Lewis" restaurant with an open fire is a nice cosy spot for a meal and the food was first class. The main public bar looked like a great meeting place and eatery to meet friends. Very enjoyable stay, however lost my top mark due to service at breakfast which was not in keeping with its 4 star rating. As we eat each course the dishes just piled up on my table and I never got offered a refill for my coffee. The food was plentiful and of a high standard at dinner and breakfast. A great hotel for a special occasion or romantic short break..
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really looked forward to the break as it was a birthday treat, booked a suite. The positives - room overlooked the garden with nice views, large enough to stretch out and relax, food in restaurant was gorgeous with excellent service. Nice touch the owner greeting the diners.
reviews.title: Very dissapointed
Afternoon Tea
reviews.text: The one downside was the lack of heating in the room. I had to phone down 3 times to ask about the heating 'November is cold in NI' and at one stage I was going to get in the car and go home it was that cold. I was told on the 2nd phone call that the heating was old and it takes a while to come through - 3 hours after check in we started to feel the heat coming through, just in time for us going to dinner. It spoiled the stay and I would not rush back despite the positives.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was there for a wedding and I have to say I was not impressed at all . When we arrived after a long journey we ordered Tea and sandwiches before the wedding service began and we we received our tea but no sandwiches when we came out of the service we reordered our tea and sandwiches only to receive the sandwiches but drinks only arrived after our sandwiches were eaten.The Service was beautiful except we could not hear it as the noise from the bar and restaurant were so loud and people were continually walking in to the service via two doors which did not close properly and were not manned to insure the Service was not interrupted.we were continually move from bar to other rooms while the function room was set up and after dinner moved again so the room could be cleared or function. We found the staff very unhelpful . Last orders were called at 11.30 and the disco was ordered to stop at 12 o clock . for a place that says your wedding is exclusive to you and there is only one wedding a day forgets to mention that it is shared with the public . For wedding guests who had travelled a long way and their only accommodation was in nearby hotel and guest house because your hotel was booked were shipped out at twelve o clock .
reviews.title: Magical!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Old Inn Crawfordsburn for a wedding. Could have travelled home but decided to enjoy the weekend and was a good choice. We were lucky get the Fern suite which had a 4 poster bed and was beautiful. The bed was reasonably comfortable, but a bit lumpy in parts. After partying at the wedding though, we were exhausted and slept very well. Everything you needed in the room and very comfortable. The whole hotel was so quaint, inside and out and furnished to a high standard throughout. Our room had the heat on full boom and we couldn't get it turned down, which was frustrating, but not a problem. For a cold early February stay there was a wonderful atmosphere throughout with fires and stoves on in every room. The wedding meal was lovely and the breakfast was very good with plentiful cereals, fruit and bread and the cooked breakfast was served to the table.
reviews.title: Stayed for a wedding, would recommend

reviews.text: The rate for the night wasn't the cheapest, but it was worth it for us and I would definitely recommend again.
reviews.title: room not up to standard expected

reviews.text: recently stayed for a wedding but found no bedside light. Twin room (Thatch Patch) if I wanted to get up to go to toilet had to switch on all lights in the room - luckily I was on my own as imagine other room user would not have been amused to be woken by bright lights.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: Window and wardrobe faced onto back of hotel which was well lit but curtain and wardrobe (which was see through to outside!) let a lot of illumination in.
reviews.title: Amazing experience from start to finish

reviews.text: Radiator extremely hot, dangerously so I consider.
reviews.title: Lewis is my new favorite dining experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi spent the night here and it was the best ever, as soon as we arrived, alison greeted us at reception, she was so so friendly and made us wellcome. We were in the Fern room and wow wat a room, my partner and myself had pre;dinner drinks, and again the staff were so helpful, we then had dinner and it was the best ever and the service 110% johnny one of staff was so nice to us, all and all i would love tocomment it to thebelfast telegraph.Hope to see you soon. Angela Hanna
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Northern Ireland

reviews.text: I was at a wedding here last week, didn't stay but have done previously, The Hotel is situated just outside Bangor near Crawfordsburn Country Park, it sits in gorgeous setting, the Hotel is an old coaching inn from around the 1600s, white and black wooden exterior but don't let that fool you. Inside is quant, old photos on the walls, a number of real fires throughout the bars and function rooms.
reviews.title: Warm relaxed atmosphere

reviews.text: The staff where excellent, couldn't have been friendlier or more professional, all needs where quickly tended too. The food at the wedding was excellent, and the guinness was fantastic.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.text: Great place for a bite to eat, a drink or a wedding.
reviews.title: Very pleasant unique place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated in the quiet village of Crawfordsburn which is close to Belfast with a good transport system which links the village to Belfast & all it's wonderful shops. Our stay at The Old Inn, Crawfordsburn on 3rd December was curtesy of a generous birthday present of vouchers from family. The suite we stayed in was spotlessly clean & gorgeous with a four-poster bed and slipper bath (in the spacious en-suite). The dinner was sumptuous served in the lovely dinning room by courteous staff. After dinner drinks were taken in the cosy bar. From start to finish the whole experience was magical and I can't wait to get back again for another getaway.
reviews.title: a late wedding review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for a night with my partner having had my work's christmas function here. The food was pretty good and the hotel and its appointments are very charming. The bar area has a lovely log fire and there is a small room called the library just off reception which is nice for a quiet drink. Outside there is a lovely decked area, again with a big log fire. Breakfast the next morning was also very good with a selection of breads etc plus a complimentary cooked breakfast. The room itself was quaint and comfortable with a flat screen tv, however the tv only had 8 channels (but then who stays in a hotel to watch tv?) However the bad aspect of this stay (which probably isnt relevant for everyone elses stay as my bad point was linked to other people having their christmas functions there) was that after the bar had closed people who had booked rooms seemingly invited the rest of their friends up for a party. At about 2am, having had no sleep due to loud talking/singing/music from the next room I called reception. The chap on the desk was very helpful and I could hear him arguing with the people in the next room who were giving him a lot of abuse. Eventually it quietened down but not until about half 3/4am.
reviews.title: good and bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a fairly pleasant stay however I wouldn't recommend staying if there are christmas functions booked as you probably won't get too much sleep!
reviews.title: Steak and Mulled Wine!

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in December 11. This place is very popular for weddings and christmas parties - I took the girlfriend here for a steak dinner, the open log fire and plenty of mulled wine.
reviews.title: Unusual and atmospheric

reviews.text: The food is always great but this is the first time I've stayed and I was not disappointed. I stayed in the sunflower room right at the end of the corrider and had the advantage of a big bay window which was filled by an island of tables with the tv on one side facing the bed and a vanity mirror on the other. Robes, slippers, decent bathroom with toiletries all included. I had a problem with the shower but that was sorted out in no time.
reviews.title: Victorian Afternoon Tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place and has just become my favourite place to go at Christmas. No doubt at all I'll be back next year.
reviews.title: "Food to Die For"

aka: The Old Inn Crawfordsburn Hotel Crawfordsburn
description: Step through the doors of The Old Inn to experience nearly 400 years of history. The Old Inn is the perfect retreat for both business and leisure. The Old Inn offers extensive and charming hotel and catering facilities for wedding ceremonies and receptions, business meetings and conferences, training courses, holidays and short romantic breaks and weekends. Each bedroom is uniquely styled and the Lewis Restaurant offers fantastic local produce at reasonable prices. The hotel is four star accommodation and the food is to two AA Rosette Standard. Lewis won the Taste of Ulster 2011 best restaurant in Ulster this year.
